_header: Ye that passen by the way
Subjects: scripture texts, Engl. trans. of; sermons, verse in; Christ, Passion of; Christ, address to humankind; Christ, wounds of
_description: O vos omnes qui transitis per viam — four long lines translating Lamentations 1.12

CULIi38.Transcription:
Ȝe þat goȝt bi þe weye abideȝt a litul
                    stoundeby holdeȝt & takeȝt hede ȝif þer eny is in
                    peyne ȝliche me ifondeto þe tre wiȝt nayles þre fete
                    & handes ful faste ystonge & boundeWitȝ a spere depe &
                    sore to my herte þer is ismete a wounde
CULIi38.Note:
An independent insertion into the sermon Christus passus est pro
                        nobis (ff. 59-60).
CULIi38.Editions:
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             “More English Texts from MS. Cambridge University Library
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Anglia
         93 (1975): 1-16: 4.

NLS18721.First Lines:
Ȝe þat pasen be þe weyȝeA bidet a litel
                    stounde…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…with a spere al þoru mi sideto min herte is mad
                    awounde
NLS18721.Note:
In John Grimestone’s sermon notebook. Written as one eight-line
                    stanza, abcbdbeb (or four monorhyming long lines).
